intro: Seseli langshanense, commonly known as the Langshan seseli, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Seseli langshanense is typically found in rocky or mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
